User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Content Spark application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

platform.description: The user's primary content platform (e.g., Instagram, YouTube).

contentNiche.description: The user's content niche (e.g., fitness, travel, tech).

growthGoal.description: The user's primary growth goal (e.g., reach, engagement, consistency).

BrandProfile.title: BrandProfile
BrandProfile.description: Represents the user's brand profile, including tone, target audience, and mission.

id.description: Unique identifier for the brand profile.

brandTone.description: The overall tone of the brand (e.g., professional, funny, casual).

targetAudience.description: Description of the brand's target audience.

coreMission.description: The core mission statement of the brand.

ContentLog.title: ContentLog
ContentLog.description: Represents a log of generated content, including the raw idea, AI-generated post, and image prompt.

id.description: Unique identifier for the content log.

rawIdea.description: The user's initial raw idea for the content.

aiGeneratedPost.description: The AI-generated social media post in JSON format, containing strategic rationale, platform-optimized text, and hashtags.

imagePrompt.description: The AI-generated image prompt for the post.

platform.description: The platform the content was generated for (e.g., LinkedIn, Instagram, X).

createdDate.description: Date and time the content was created.

ContentCalendarEntry.title: ContentCalendarEntry
ContentCalendarEntry.description: Represents an entry in the content calendar, including the date, content log, and platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the content calendar entry.

scheduledDate.description: The date the content is scheduled to be posted.

platform.description: The platform the content is scheduled for (e.g., LinkedIn, Instagram, X).

Trend.title: Trend
Trend.description: Represents a trending topic within a specific niche.

niche.description: The niche this trend belongs to (e.g., fitness, travel, tech).

strategicRationale.description: A strategic explanation of why this trend is relevant and how to capitalize on it.

hashtags.description: Array of relevant hashtags for the trend.

CollaborationSuggestion.title: CollaborationSuggestion
CollaborationSuggestion.description: Represents a suggested creator for collaboration.

id.description: Unique identifier for the collaboration suggestion.

requestingUserId.description: Reference to User initiating the collaboration request. (Relationship: User 1:N CollaborationSuggestion - Initiated)

suggestedUserId.description: Reference to User being suggested for collaboration. (Relationship: User 1:N CollaborationSuggestion - Suggested)

status.description: The status of the collaboration request (e.g., pending, accepted, rejected).

requestMessage.description: Message sent with the collaboration request.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability. User data and associated content are organized under user-specific paths for private data, enabling simple and secure rules based on `request.auth.uid`.  Denormalization is employed to maintain authorization independence, specifically within the ContentCalendarEntry collection. This design facilitates secure `list` operations (QAPs) through structural segregation and path-based ownership.

*   `/users/{userId}`: This path stores user profiles.  Rules here ensure only the authenticated user can access their own profile.
*   `/users/{userId}/brandProfiles/{brandProfileId}`:  Brand profiles are stored under the user who owns them, providing straightforward ownership-based security.
*   `/users/{userId}/contentLogs/{contentLogId}`: Content logs, associated with individual users, are stored under their respective user ID.
*   `/users/{userId}/contentCalendarEntries/{contentCalendarEntryId}`: Content calendar entries are stored under the user and include `userId` and `contentLogId` for easy querying and retrieval. This design uses path-based ownership.
*   `/trends/{trendId}`: Trends are global and accessible.  Security rules should limit write access to authorized users only (e.g., admins).
*   `/collaborationSuggestions/{collaborationSuggestionId}`: Collaboration suggestions are stored at the root level. They include `requestingUserId` and `suggestedUserId` fields. Security rules ensure only the requesting user can modify suggestions they created, and the suggested user can accept or reject the collaboration.
